45.title: YAML for Configuration
45.shortDescription: JSON is good at a lot of things. Just not configuration files.
45.longDescription: JSON is good at a lot of things, which led me to think it's great for configuration files. But it's not. YAML is the way to go.

44.title: The Rise of Metadata
44.shortDescription: Facebook's using it. Twitter too. Slack. And, now iOS 10. The metadata on your website is getting more important.
44.longDescription: Facebook's using it. Twitter too. Slack. And, now iOS 10. The metadata on your website is getting more important.

43.title: Using Ansible and Vagrant to Launch Ubuntu 16.04
43.shortDescription: Using Ansible to provision a Vagrant box, even if Python isn't installed.
43.longDescription: I've been impressed with Vagrant and with Ansible, but my provisions always took an extra step on Ubuntu 16.04. How to get Vagrant to install Python before provisioning the box.

42.title: Decoupling Transactional Email with RabbitMQ
42.shortDescription: Using RabbitMQ to separate application logic from transactional email logic.
42.longDescription: Using RabbitMQ to separate application logic from transactional email logic.

41.title: Serving HTTP/2 with nginx on Ubuntu 14.04
41.shortDescription: How I was able to get nginx serving HTTP/2 and a Let's Encrypt certificate on my Ubuntu 14.04 server.
41.longDescription: How I was able to get nginx serving HTTP/2 and a Let's Encrypt certificate on my Ubuntu 14.04 server.

40.title: A Better User Agent for NSURLRequest
40.shortDescription: The default user agent header set by NSURLRequest is awful. Do yourself a favor and change it.
40.longDescription: The default user agent header set by NSURLRequest is awful. Do yourself a favor and change it.

39.title: Short, Localized Dates and Four-Digit Years
39.shortDescription: Hacking PHP's IntlDateFormatter::SHORT to render all locales with 4-digit years.
39.longDescription: PHP's IntlDateFormatter::SHORT renders some locales with 2-digit years. I explore how to hack it to render all locales with 4-digit years.

38.title: Tracking Freeform Notifications in Git
38.shortDescription: How I embed ExpressionEngine templates into a Freeform Notification templates so they can be tracked in git.
38.longDescription: How I embed ExpressionEngine templates into a Freeform Notification templates so they can be tracked in git.

37.title: Node, Upstart, and Ubuntu 14.04
37.shortDescription: An upstart configuration for node on Ubuntu 14.04 that uses navtive options rather than resorting to "script".
37.longDescription: An upstart configuration for node on Ubuntu 14.04 that uses navtive options rather than resorting to "script".

36.title: Configuration is Not Code
36.shortDescription: Configuration does not belong in the database. We've known this for years. But configuration also does not belong in git.
36.longDescription: Configuration does not belong in the database. We've known this for years. But configuration also does not belong in git.

35.title: Stash Layouts
35.shortDescription: Stash is a powerful tool for templating in ExpressionEngine. Used the right way, it can improve the readability of templates.
35.longDescription: Stash is a powerful tool for templating in ExpressionEngine. Used the right way, it can improve the readability of templates. Used the wrong way, it can make a mess of things.

34.title: Above the Fold, Breaking the Rules
34.shortDescription: It's been hammered over and over that, on the web, there is no fold. And rightly so. But lets break the rules and make one anyway.
34.longDescription: It's been hammered over and over that, on the web, there is no fold. And rightly so. But lets break the rules and make one anyway.

33.title: From Trello to Twitter
33.shortDescription: How I use Trello to organize my upcoming Twitter tweets.
33.longDescription: After reading "Trello as a CMS," I was inspired to automate my tweets from a Trello board.

32.title: The Plugin: Your First ExpressionEngine Add-On
32.shortDescription: Writing an ExpressionEngine Add-On can be daunting. But the Plugin is a no-nonsense, easy place to start.
32.longDescription: Writing an ExpressionEngine Add-On can be daunting. But the Plugin is a no-nonsense, easy place to start.

31.title: Cache-Busting CSS and JavaScript in ExpressionEngine
31.shortDescription: Far-future cache headers are important, sure, but how do you bust the cache in ExpressionEngine when an asset changes?
31.longDescription: Far-future cache headers are important for the performance of a site. But they also require the the ability to bust the cache when an asset changes. But how do you do that in ExpressionEngine?

30.title: Introducing Max Length
30.shortDescription: Max Length is an accessory that provides a small, unobtrusive indicator for how many characters an input has left before reaching its maximum length.
30.longDescription: Max Length is an accessory that provides a small, unobtrusive indicator for how many characters an input has left before reaching its maximum length.

29.title: On Development Decisions
29.shortDescription: Black and white. Good and bad. The right way and the wrong way. It would be great if web development fell into nice neat little categories. It doesn't.
29.longDescription: Black and white. Good and bad. The right way and the wrong way. It would be great if web development fell into nice neat little categories. It doesn't.

28.title: Squashing Commits
28.shortDescription: Your git history can read like a rambling stream-of-consciousness tome or a sharp-witted novella. Do us all a favor and squash your commits.
28.longDescription: Your git history is like a book. It can read like a rambling stream-of-consciousness tome. Or you can squash your commits to read like a sharp-witted novella. Do us all a favor and squash your commits.

27.title: Release Cycles
27.shortDescription: Changes on the web are instantaneous. Changes to an iPhone app are not. How that difference affects the design of an app.
27.longDescription: I work on the internet, where I mostly build and maintain websites. Changes on the web are instantaneous. But recently, I worked on an iPhone app where this isn't the case. And it got me thinking about release cycles and their impact.

26.title: Oops I created a Spambot
26.shortDescription: "Build it and they will come" doesn't work on the internet, but Twitter provided a world of opportunity for its5.info.
26.longDescription: "Build it and they will come" doesn't work on the internet. its5.info needed a strategy. There were several options I knew wouldn't work. But Twitter provided a world of opportunity.

25.title: Why I Built It: its5.info
25.shortDescription: It's 5 o'clock somewhere, they say. But where? The story of why I built its5.info
25.longDescription: On a cold day in late March, 2014, someone just trotted out the old phrase, "It's 5 o'clock somewhere," and I immediately wondered where? That's when I had the idea to build a website that tells me where in the world it's 5 pm.

13.title: Cache-Busting in Node.js
13.shortDescription: Far-future cache headers are important, sure, but how do you bust the cache in Node when an asset changes?
13.longDescription: Far-future cache headers are important for the performance of a site. But they also require the the ability to bust the cache when an asset changes. But how do you do that in Node.js?

2.title: On Progressive Enhancement, Responsive Design, and IE
